item.title: Show and Tell (Updater Style!)
item.dc:creator: @Evil1 Evil_
item.description:
@Evil1 wrote:

Umm, I don’t do mine the same as you all and mine will probably break pretty easy lmao

[code=Java]
import java.util.ArrayList;

import org.apache.bcel.classfile.JavaClass;
import org.apache.bcel.classfile.Method;
import org.apache.bcel.generic.ClassGen;

public class StringWrapper implements Transform {

public ClassGen processTransform(ArrayList<JavaClass> classes) {
	for(JavaClass jc : classes) {
		for(Method m : jc.getMethods()) {
			if(m.getName().equals("equals")) {
				System.out.println("StringWrapper: " + jc.getClassName());
				return new ClassGen(jc);
			}
		}
	}
	return null;
}

}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Show and Tell (Updater Style!)
item.dc:creator: @White_Castle White Castle
item.description:
@White_Castle wrote:

[code]package org.abot.loader.trans;

import java.io.;
import java.util.;
import java.util.Map.Entry;

import org.abot.TransformationUtilities;
import org.abot.logging.Logger;
import org.abot.logging.Logger.Priority;
import org.abot.trans.;
import org.apache.bcel.Constants;
import org.apache.bcel.classfile.;
import org.apache.bcel.generic.*;

public class UnpackTransformationApplicator implements Transformer {
public void transform(ClassGen[] classGens, String argument, boolean verbose) throws Throwable {
if(argument == null) {
Logger.log(Priority.FATAL, “no xml file listing client transformations specified!”);
return;
}
for(ClassGen classGen : classGens) {
ConstantPoolGen constantPool = classGen.getConstantPool();
if(classGen.getSuperclassName().equals(“java.applet.Applet”)) {
Field client = null;
for(Field field : classGen.getFields()) {
if(field.isPrivate() && field.getSignature().equals(“Ljava/applet/Applet;”))
client = field;
}
TransformationUtilities.addGetMutator(classGen, classGen.getClassName(), client, “getClient”, verbose);
continue;
}
Field cache = null;
for(Field field : classGen.getFields()) {
if(field.isProtected() && field.getSignature().equals(“Ljava/util/Hashtable;”))
cache = field;
}
if(cache == null)
continue;
Type fieldType = cache.getType();
Method init = classGen.containsMethod("", “([B)V”); MethodGen initGen = new MethodGen(init, classGen.getClassName(), constantPool); InstructionList instructionList = initGen.getInstructionList(); InstructionHandle end = instructionList.getEnd(); InstructionFactory instructionFactory = new InstructionFactory(classGen, constantPool); if(verbose) Logger.log(Priority.NORMAL, “set to load transformers from \”" + argument + “\”"); end.setInstruction(instructionFactory.createConstant(argument)); InstructionHandle last = instructionList.append(end, new ALOAD(0)); for(Instruction instruction : new Instruction[] {
instructionFactory.createGetField(classGen.getClassName(), cache.getName(), fieldType),
new ICONST(verbose ? 1 : 0),
instructionFactory.createInvoke(getClass().getName(), “transform”, Type.VOID, new Type[] {Type.STRING, fieldType, Type.BOOLEAN}, Constants.INVOKESTATIC),
new RETURN()
})
last = instructionList.append(last, instruction);
classGen.replaceMethod(init, initGen.getMethod());
}
}

public static void transform(String fileName, Hashtable<String, byte[]> cache, boolean verbose) throws IOException {
	List<Entry<String, byte[]>> entries = new LinkedList<Entry<String,byte[]>>();
	entries.addAll(cache.entrySet());
	ClassGen[] classGens = new ClassGen[entries.size()];
	for(int i = 0; i < classGens.length; i++) {
		Entry<String, byte[]> entry = entries.get(i);
		classGens[i] = new ClassGen(new ClassParser(new ByteArrayInputStream(entry.getValue()), entry.getKey().replace('.', '/') + ".class").parse());
	}
	TransformerConfiguration[] transformerConfigurations = new TransformerConfiguration[0];
	try {
		transformerConfigurations = TransformerConfiguration.loadFromXML(fileName);
	} catch(Throwable t) {
		t.printStackTrace();
	}
	int errorCount = 0;
	for(TransformerConfiguration transformerConfiguration : transformerConfigurations) {
		try {
			transformerConfiguration.transform(classGens);
		} catch(Throwable t) {
			t.printStackTrace();
			errorCount++;
		}
	}
	if(verbose)
		Logger.log(Priority.NORMAL, "finished " + transformerConfigurations.length + " transformations (with " + (errorCount == 0 ? "no" : errorCount) + " error" + (errorCount == 1 ? "" : "s") + ")");
}

}[/code]

Read full topic

What does isMutable mean?

item.title: Show and Tell (Updater Style!)
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“io9, post:7, topic:117917”]private void getStringWrapper() {
for(ClassGen c : rsClasses) {
if(c.getInterfaces().length == 1 && c.containsMethod(“toString”, “()Ljava/lang/String;”) != null && c.containsMethod(“hashCode”, “()I”) != null) {
for(Field f : c.getFields()) {
if (f.getType().equals(Type.BOOLEAN) && !f.isStatic()) {
addMethod(c, “isMutable”, f);
} else if (f.getType().equals(Type.INT) && !f.isPrivate() && !f.isStatic()) {
addMethod(c, “getLength”, f);
} else if (f.getType().equals(new ArrayType(Type.BYTE, 1)) && !f.isStatic()) {
addMethod(c, “getBytes”, f);
} else if (f.getType().equals(Type.INT) && f.isPrivate() && !f.isStatic()) {
addMethod(c, “getHash”, f);
}
}
}
}
}
Actually Kryp, Canvas is the easiest :P[/quote]
:o Io9, I can see a miss indentation… You always get up me about it.

item.title: Show and Tell (Updater Style!)
item.dc:creator: @Silver_Lining Silver Lining
item.description:
@Silver_Lining wrote:

[code]package updater;

import org.apache.bcel.generic.ClassGen;
import org.apache.bcel.classfile.Field;
import org.apache.bcel.classfile.Method;

public class RSString extends Transform{
private int injected;
public void update(){
long l = System.currentTimeMillis();
ClassGen c = findRSString();
c.addInterface(“hooks.RSString”);
names.put(“string”, c.getClassName());
bytes©;
long time = System.currentTimeMillis() - l;
System.out.println(“Injected “+injected+”/1 RSString methods into “+c.getClassName()+” in “+time+” milliseconds.”);
}
private ClassGen findRSString(){
for(ClassGen cg : classes.values()){
if(cg.containsMethod(“toString”, “()Ljava/lang/String;”) != null){
if(cg.getInterfaces().length == 1)
return cg;
}
}
System.err.println(“Error hooking RSString.”);
return null;
}
private void bytes(ClassGen cg){
for(Field f : cg.getFields()){
if(!f.isStatic() && f.getSignature().equals("[B")){ cg.addMethod(createMethod(cg, “bytes”, “[B”, cg.getClassName(), f.getName(), “[B”, false)); injected++; return; } } } } [/code]

item.title: Show and Tell (Updater Style!)
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

    public boolean find(ClassGen cg) {
        if (cg.containsMethod("toString", "()Ljava/lang/String;") != null
                && cg.containsMethod("hashCode", "()I") != null) {
            setClassGen(cg);
            for (Field f : cg.getFields()) {
                if (f.isStatic()) {
                    continue;
                }
                if (f.getType().equals(byteArrayType)) {
                    fields.put("getData", f);
                } else if (!f.isPrivate() && f.getType().equals(Type.INT)) {
                    fields.put("getLength", f);
                } else if (f.isPrivate() && f.getType().equals(Type.BOOLEAN)) {
                    fields.put("isEditable", f);
                }
            }
            return true;
        }
        return false;
    }

Read full topic

item.title: Show and Tell (Updater Style!)
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

[code]package update;

import org.apache.bcel.generic.;
import java.util.;
import org.apache.bcel.classfile.*;
import org.apache.bcel.Constants;

public class StringWrapper extends Hook {

public StringWrapper(HashMap<String, ClassGen> m, Properties props) {
    super(m, props);
}

public boolean run() throws Exception {
    for (ClassGen cg : getMap().values()) {
        for (Method m : cg.getMethods()) {
            if (m.getName().equals("toString") 
                    && cg.getInterfaceNames().length > 0) {
                set("StringWrapper", cg.getClassName());
                addInterface(cg.getClassName(),
                        "info.scanningyour.ares.hooks.StringWrapper");
                break;
            }
        }
        if (get("StringWrapper") != null
                && get("StringWrapper").equals(cg.getClassName())) {
            for (Field f : cg.getFields()) {
                if (!f.isStatic()
                        && f.getType().equals(new ArrayType(Type.BYTE, 1))) {
                    set("StringWrapperBytes",
                            (cg.getClassName() + "." + f.getName()));
                    addMethodToReturnField(cg, "getBytes", f.getType(),
                            cg.getClassName(), f.getName(), f.getType(),
                            Constants.GETFIELD);
                    return true;
                }
            }
        }
    }
    return false;
}

}
[/code]

Read full topic
